title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Each unit has been assigned a two hour slot to run the tearoom. Unit leaders are asked to please update the staffing sign-up sheet with names of volunteers available for their session. If you are not a leader and are looking to sign up or to check what you’ve signed up for, please contact your unit leaders or contact us.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Roles
Each unit should recruit volunteers to fill the below roles. Volunteers can be leaders, young leaders, the girls, their families or anyone else willing to support us.

Leader in charge / first aid.
Order taker / money handler. Needs to be comfortable using the SumUp machine.
Hot drinks maker.
Cake server.
Washing up.
Front of house. This includes clearing and cleaning tables and welcoming customers.

Anyone who is aged 10 years or under can only be front of house or on washing up and should be supervised by another adult.
A member of the Girl Guiding Bunkfest tearoom committee will be on hand to help with setup (10am) and close down (6pm) each day.

Volunteers for setting up and taking down
We are also looking for volunteers to help up set up the tearoom on Thursday 28th (time TBC) and to take it down on Sunday 31st (6-7pm). If you are available, please let us know.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Where to find us
We will be in our own tent in the Bullcroft.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
What to wear
We recommend wearing comfortable clothes to suit the weather, sensible shoes for periods of standing and walking, and if you are a Girlguiding member, to wear your uniform top. Long hair should be tied back and jewellery removed (wedding bands are permitted). We will provide aprons on the day.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Food safety and hygiene
We will be following best practice for food safety and hygiene in the tearoom and will ask all volunteers to:

Wash their hands upon arrival and as necessary throughout the session.
To use tongs to handle food. We will have separate tongs for our vegan and gluten-free products.
To help keep the area clean and tidy throughout the day.
To pass any questions about ingredients, allergens or dietary requirements to the Leader in Charge.

title: Finding us
text: We will be in the Bullcroft during Bunkfest 2025: to the left of the Bullcroft stage, next to the craft tent and Kapow Gaming.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Below are some frequently asked questions. For any thing else please contact us.


There are many ways you can help us during Bunkfest or in the run up to it - let us know what you would like to do. We are currently seeking volunteers to:

Help us with staffing:

Setting up our tearoom on Thursday 28th Aug.
Volunteering in the tearoom on Friday 29th to Sunday 31st Aug.
Taking our tearoom down on Sunday 28th Aug.

Bake us cakes.
Making decorations or displays over the summer.
Visiting our tearoom during Bunkfest. We’ll be in the Bullcroft.
Or any other way you can think of.




We are fundraising to pay for repairs to our Wallingford hut, to support our girls on their trip to Mexico in 2026 and to raise money for our District general funds. This will help girls across Wallingford, Cholsey and Long Wittenham access Girlguiding opportunities, including things like uniforms, camps, flags, equipment and making sure no one misses out due to costs.
The Bunkfest Tearoom will also improve our visibility in the community and promote Girlguiding, team-building and friendship across the units. Getting involved in these fundraising opportunities strengthens all of our groups and the girls themselves in the long-term.



We have decided to use set recipes so that we can be sure of what stock we have and what ingredients have been used. This will help us on the day to better manage our use of stock and to help people with allergies and dietary requirements to enjoy our cakes safely.



Please contact your unit leaders or contact us and we’ll get back to you.



Please contact your unit leaders or contact us as soon as you can, so we can arrange an alternative.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Unit leaders are collecting details of volunteers for staffing the tearoom and baking at unit meetings and by email or WhatsApp.
We will update the frequently asked questions page as more questions come in, but if there is anything else please complete this short form and we will aim to email you back as soon as we can.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
We are running a Mad Hatter’s tearoom at Bunkfest 2025 on Friday 29th to Sunday 31st August in the Bullcroft. This site contains information on ways to support us by volunteering as staff or by baking cakes. There is also a section for frequently asked questions, but please contact us if there is anything else.
We’re looking forward to seeing you there!

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Thank you for volunteering to bake for us. We have decided to use set recipes this year to help us better manage stock on the day. Below you will find links to the recipes we would like to use and any extra notes we’ve added to help. Please do not add or substitute other ingredients to the recipes so that on the day we can be sure exactly what’s in each bake and to answer any questions from people with allergies or dietary requirements.
Please do not cut cakes or traybakes. This will help us keep the cakes fresher and allow us to control portion sizes.
Unit leaders are asked to please update the baking sign-up sheet with names and bakes of volunteers so we can keep track of stock. If you are not a leader and are looking to sign up or to check what you’ve signed up for, please contact your unit leaders or contact us.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Dropping off bakes
Please ensure bakes are in sealed containers. If you’d like your container back after the event, please label the container with your name/contact details - these details will not be shared with anyone outside of our volunteers.
Times and locations for dropoff:

Thursday 28th Aug: anytime to Sam in Wallingford. Please let us know in advance and we will give you contact details.
Friday 29th Aug: morning as above. From 2pm - 6pm deliver direct to the stall on the Bullcroft.
Saturday 30th Aug: 10am - 12pm deliver direct to the stall on the Bullcroft.
Sunday 31st Aug: 10am - 12pm deliver direct to the stall on the Bullcroft.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Food safety and hygiene
We need to be sure our bakes are safe to enjoy. We’re asking all bakers to maintain good food safety and hygiene practices throughout baking by following the below guidance.

Ensure all surfaces and equipment are clean and safe to use.
Wear clean clothes and/or an apron, remove jewellery and tie long hair back.
Wash your hands before starting and regularly throughout the process.
Follow our chosen recipes so we can be certain what ingredients and allergens are present.
Be aware of cross-contamination and take steps to minimise risk. For example bake in a nut-free environment, don’t reuse spoons, be aware of debris on surfaces, etc.

If there are any questions or concerns please contact us.

title: Girlguiding Mad Hatter's Tearoom at Bunkfest 2025
text:
Recipes

Double chocolate muffinsGluten free brownieLemon traybakeVegan flapjackVictoria sponge



Ingredients
Dry:
2 cups (250g) plain flour (spooned & leveled)
1 cup (200g) granulated sugar
1/2 cup (40g) unsweetened natural cocoa powder
1 teaspoon bicarbonate of soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
200g semi-sweet chocolate chips

Wet:
2 large eggs, at room temperature
3/4 cup (185g) full fat sour cream or plain yogurt, at room temperature
1/2 cup (120ml) vegetable oil
1/2 cup (120ml) whole milk, at room temperature
1 and 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract



Method

Preheat fan oven to 200°C. Line muffin tins with 14-15 cupcake liners.
Whisk the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, bicarbonate of soda, salt, and chocolate chips together in a large bowl. Set aside.
Whisk the eggs, sour cream, oil, milk, and vanilla extract together until combined. Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and fold together with a silicone spatula or wooden spoon until completely combined. (Batter is quite thick, so recommend a spatula or spoon over a whisk.) Avoid overmixing. The batter will be thick and sticky.
Spoon the batter into liners, fill them no more than 3/4 full. Bake for 5 minutes at 200°C. then, keeping the muffins in the oven, reduce the oven temperature to 155°C. Bake for an additional 15-16 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Cool muffins for 10 minutes in the pan, then transfer to a wire rack.

Adapted from https://sallysbakingaddiction.com/double-chocolate-muffins/#tasty-recipes-96196.



Please use a shop bought Gluten Free Brownie mix. For example:

Betty Crocker gluten free chocolate fudge brownie mix - available in Wallingford Waitrose.
Tesco Free From Chocolate Brownie Mix

Do not cut.
Please attach the empty packet / box to the container of brownies so we know the ingredients.



Ingredients
Sponge:
225g (8oz) butter or baking spread at room temperature, plus extra for greasing
225g (8oz) caster sugar
275g (10oz) self-raising flour
2 level tsp baking powder
4 free-range eggs
4 tbsp milk
2 unwaxed lemons, finely grated zest only

Glaze:
175g (6oz) granulated sugar
2 lemons, juice only



Method

Preheat the oven to 180C/160C Fan/Gas 4. Grease a 30x23cm (12x9in) tin with butter and line the base with baking paper.
Measure all the ingredients into a large bowl and beat for 2 minutes, or until well blended. Turn the mixture into the prepared tin and level the top.
Bake for 35–40 minutes, until the cake has shrunk a little from the sides of the tin and springs back when lightly touched with a fingertip in the centre of the cake.
Meanwhile, make the glaze. Mix the sugar with the lemon juice and stir to a runny consistency.
Leave the cake to cool for 5 minutes in the tin, then lift out, with the lining paper still attached, and place on wire rack set over a tray.
Brush the glaze all over the surface of the warm cake and leave to set. Do not cut.

Adapted from https://www.bbc.co.uk/food/recipes/lemon_drizzle_traybake_01890.



To be made using a vegan butter for example:

Vitalite
Flora Plant Butter
Stork

There is the option to add dried fruit (no nuts) or to leave plain.

Ingredients
200g (7oz) vegan butter (see note above for suggestions)
150g (5oz) demerara sugar
4 Tbsp. golden syrup
400g (14oz) jumbo oats
Optional: 100g (3½oz) raisins or sultanas



Method

Preheat oven to 190°C (170°C fan) mark 5. Grease and line a 20.5cm (8in) square baking tin with parchment paper.
Melt the butter in a large pan and add the sugar and syrup. Stir and heat gently until the sugar dissolves.
Remove pan from heat and stir in the oats and optional dried fruit. Press into tin and bake for 15-20min until lightly golden.
Leave to cool. Do not cut.
Please ensure flapjacks are labelled with choice of vegan butter.

Adapted from https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/uk/food/recipes/a535174/traditional-flapjacks/.




Ingredients
Sponge:
225g (8oz) baking spread, straight from the fridge, plus extra for greasing
225g (8oz) caster sugar
4 eggs
225g (8oz) self-raising flour
1 level tsp baking powder

Filling & Topping:
½ × 370g jar strawberry jam  (or other flavour, but please label cakes with jam used)
A little caster sugar, to sprinkle



Method

Preheat the oven to 180°C/160°C fan/Gas 4. Lightly grease two 20cm (8in) deep loose-bottomed sandwich tins and line the bases with non-stick baking paper.
Measure the sponge ingredients into a large bowl or freestanding mixer and beat for about 2 minutes with an electric whisk until beautifully smooth and lighter in colour. The time will vary according to the efficiency of the mixer.
Divide the mixture between the tins and level the tops. Bake in the oven for about 25 minutes, or until well risen and golden and the cakes are shrinking away from the sides of the tins. The tops of the cakes should spring back when pressed lightly with a finger.
Leave the cakes to cool in the tins for a few moments, then run a palette knife around the edge of the tins to free the sides. Turn the cakes out, then peel off the paper and leave to cool completely on a wire rack.
Choose the cake with the best top and sit aside. Put the other cake top downwards on a serving plate. Spread this cake carefully with the jam. Sit the other cake on top.
Sprinkle with sugar. Do not cut.

Adapted from https://www.maryberry.co.uk/recipes/recipe/victoria-sponge-sandwich.
